Integrations.summary: Tight integration between website and admin panel through shared Firebase/Firestore backend. Real-time data flows enable live dashboard updates when forms are submitted. Environment-based configuration allows single codebase deployment across different environments.

flow.action: User submits service form on website
Form data validated and sent to Firestore collection
Admin panel real-time listener detects new submission
Dashboard updates in real-time with new stats
Admin reviews and updates submission status
flow.result: Status change triggers notification to user

firebase_project.access: Both website and admin panel authenticated to same project

pattern.implementation: Each service has dedicated Firestore collection

strict_mode.benefit: Catches type errors at compile-time, prevents runtime bugs

type_definitions.approach: Explicit TypeScript interfaces for all data types

firestore_typing.pattern: Type-safe Firestore queries with converter functions

component_development.philosophy: Functional components as default; minimal use of class components

pattern.name: Functional Components with Hooks
pattern.benefit: Modern React best practices, better performance

pattern.usage: Interactive components explicitly marked with 'use client'

pattern.name: Composition over Inheritance
pattern.example: Components composed from smaller, reusable components

pattern.name: React Context for Global State
pattern.usage: AuthContext provides authentication to entire app

firestore_schema.description: All 7 collections follow consistent base schema with service-specific extensions
firestore_schema.service_specific: Each service has custom fields (deviceType, manufacturer, boatName, etc.)

data_flow_lifecycle.stage: 1. Collection - User submits form, document created in service-specific collection
2. Notification - Cloud Function triggers email to admin and user
3. Real-Time Update - Dashboard listener detects new document, stats update
4. Review - Admin opens submission detail modal
6. Notification - Cloud Function triggers email with status update to user

real_time_synchronization.mechanism: Firestore onSnapshot() listeners in custom hooks
real_time_synchronization.advantage: Instant updates across all connected clients, no polling needed
real_time_synchronization.example: Multiple admins see same data, updates reflected within 100ms

strength.title: Clear Architectural Separation
strength.benefit: Website (marketing/forms) and admin panel (management) are completely separate projects with distinct responsibilities

strength.title: Type Safety Throughout
strength.benefit: TypeScript strict mode enables compile-time error checking, prevents runtime bugs, excellent IDE support

strength.title: Real-Time Capabilities
strength.benefit: Firestore listeners provide instant dashboard updates without polling or manual refresh

strength.title: Modern Tooling Stack
strength.benefit: Next.js 16 + Turbopack, Vite 5, React 19 provide fast development and build experience

strength.title: SEO Optimization
strength.benefit: Dynamic metadata, JSON-LD, robots.ts, sitemap.ts ensure excellent search visibility

strength.title: Monorepo Organization
strength.benefit: Two projects in single repository with clear separation, independent configs, simplified deployment

strength.title: Service-Oriented Design
strength.benefit: 6 distinct services with dedicated pages, forms, collections - modular, scalable architecture

structure.base_schema: All submissions have: id, name, email, phone, timestamp, status, adminNotes
structure.variations: Each service adds custom fields relevant to that regulatory domain

data_model.timestamp_handling: Firestore server timestamps prevent client-side manipulation
data_model.scalability: Firestore indexed queries for fast filtering by status/date

gap.observation: Cloud Functions for email notifications are not visible in codebase
gap.opportunity: Document all Cloud Functions; consider exposing as HTTP functions

gap.observation: No validation library visible (e.g., React Hook Form, Zod)
gap.opportunity: Implement structured validation with TypeScript schemas

gap.observation: Only email/password auth for admin; no OAuth or MFA
gap.opportunity: Add OAuth2 providers (Google, Microsoft) and MFA for security

gap.observation: No testing framework visible in package.json
gap.opportunity: Add Jest + React Testing Library for unit tests, Playwright for E2E

gap.observation: Only Vercel Analytics; no structured error monitoring
gap.opportunity: Add Sentry or similar for error tracking and performance monitoring
